results.title: Combining lisinopril and l-arginine slows disease progression and reduces endothelin-1 in passive Heymann nephritis.
results.text_hl: Combining @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Arginine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001120 @@@l-arginine@@@ slows disease progression and reduces @GENE_EDN1 @GENE_24323 @@@endothelin-1@@@ in passive @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@Heymann nephritis@@@.

citations.NLM: Zoja C, Benigni A, Camozzi D, Corna D, Longaretti L, Todeschini M, Remuzzi G. Combining lisinopril and l-arginine slows disease progression and reduces endothelin-1 in passive Heymann nephritis. Kidney Int. 2003 Sep;64(3):857-63. PMID: 12911535

results.title: Comparison of immunosuppressive therapeutic regimens in patients with nephrotic syndrome due to idiopathic membranous nephropathy.
results.text_hl: Comparison of immunosuppressive therapeutic regimens in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Nephrotic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D009404 @@@nephrotic syndrome@@@ due to @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@idiopathic membranous nephropathy@@@.

citations.NLM: Kosmadakis G, Filiopoulos V, Smirloglou D, Skarlas P, Georgoulias C, Michail S. Comparison of immunosuppressive therapeutic regimens in patients with nephrotic syndrome due to idiopathic membranous nephropathy. Ren Fail. 2010 Jun;32(5):566-71. PMID: 20486839

results.title: Effect of combining ACE inhibitor and statin in severe experimental nephropathy.
results.text_hl: Up-regulation of @GENE_CCL2 @GENE_24770 @@@monocyte chemoattractant protein-1@@@ (@GENE_CCL2 @GENE_24770 @@@MCP-1@@@) mRNA in @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@PHN@@@ kidneys was not affected by @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, it was inhibited by 30% after @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, and almost completely normalized by @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Zoja C, Corna D, Rottoli D, Cattaneo D, Zanchi C, Tomasoni S, Abbate M, Remuzzi G. Effect of combining ACE inhibitor and statin in severe experimental nephropathy. Kidney Int. 2002 May;61(5):1635-45. PMID: 11967013
citations.BibTeX: @article{11967013, title={Effect of combining ACE inhibitor and statin in severe experimental nephropathy.}, author={Zoja C and Corna D and Rottoli D and Cattaneo D and Zanchi C and Tomasoni S and Abbate M and Remuzzi G}, journal={Kidney Int}, volume={61}, number={5}, pages={1635-45}}

results.title: Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibition prevents loss of glomerular hydraulic permeability in passive heymann nephritis.
results.text_hl: Morphometric analysis of glomerular capillary by light and electron microscopy was performed in normal control @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ and in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ injected with rabbit anti-Fx 1A antibody, 12 months after induction of @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@PHN@@@. A group of @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@PHN@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ during the observation period was also investigated.

citations.NLM: Remuzzi A, Monaci N, Bonassi ME, Corna D, Zoja C, Mohammed EI, Remuzzi G. Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibition prevents loss of glomerular hydraulic permeability in passive heymann nephritis. Lab Invest. 1999 Dec;79(12):1501-10. PMID: 10616201
citations.BibTeX: @article{10616201, title={Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibition prevents loss of glomerular hydraulic permeability in passive heymann nephritis.}, author={Remuzzi A and Monaci N and Bonassi ME and Corna D and Zoja C and Mohammed EI and Remuzzi G}, journal={Lab Invest}, volume={79}, number={12}, pages={1501-10}}

results.title: Blocking angiotensin II synthesis/activity preserves glomerular nephrin in rats with severe nephrosis.
results.text_hl: Additional @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@PHN@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ or AII receptor blocker @CHEMICAL_L_158809 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C070967 @@@L-158,809@@@ and studied at 8 mo.

citations.NLM: Benigni A, Tomasoni S, Gagliardini E, Zoja C, Grunkemeyer JA, Kalluri R, Remuzzi G. Blocking angiotensin II synthesis/activity preserves glomerular nephrin in rats with severe nephrosis. J Am Soc Nephrol. 2001 May;12(5):941-948. PMID: 11316852
citations.BibTeX: @article{11316852, title={Blocking angiotensin II synthesis/activity preserves glomerular nephrin in rats with severe nephrosis.}, author={Benigni A and Tomasoni S and Gagliardini E and Zoja C and Grunkemeyer JA and Kalluri R and Remuzzi G}, journal={J Am Soc Nephrol}, volume={12}, number={5}, pages={941-948}}

results.title: The renoprotective properties of angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors in a chronic model of membranous nephropathy are solely due to the inhibition of angiotensin II: evidence based on comparative studies with a receptor antagonist.
results.text_hl: Eight normal @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were used as controls. Untreated @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@PHN@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ developed @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, while @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@PHN@@@ given @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ or @CHEMICAL_L_158809 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C070967 @@@L-158,809@@@ all had systolic blood pressure values even lower than those of normal @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Zoja C, Donadelli R, Corna D, Testa D, Facchinetti D, Maffi R, Luzzana E, Colosio V, Bertani T, Remuzzi G. The renoprotective properties of angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors in a chronic model of membranous nephropathy are solely due to the inhibition of angiotensin II: evidence based on comparative studies with a receptor antagonist. Am J Kidney Dis. 1997 Feb;29(2):254-64. PMID: 9016898
citations.BibTeX: @article{9016898, title={The renoprotective properties of angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors in a chronic model of membranous nephropathy are solely due to the inhibition of angiotensin II: evidence based on comparative studies with a receptor antagonist.}, author={Zoja C and Donadelli R and Corna D and Testa D and Facchinetti D and Maffi R and Luzzana E and Colosio V and Bertani T and Remuzzi G}, journal={Am J Kidney Dis}, volume={29}, number={2}, pages={254-64}}

results.title: Comparison of the influence of angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor lisinopril and angiotensin II receptor antagonist losartan in patients with idiopathic membranous nephropathy and nephrotic syndrome.
results.text_hl: Comparison of the influence of @GENE_ACE @GENE_1636 @@@angiotensin-converting enzyme@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and angiotensin II receptor antagonist @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@idiopathic membranous nephropathy@@@ and @DISEASE_Nephrotic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D009404 @@@nephrotic syndrome@@@.

results.title: Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibition prevents glomerular-tubule disconnection and atrophy in passive Heymann nephritis, an effect not observed with a calcium antagonist.
results.text_hl: Two additional groups of @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis_Membranous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015433 @@@PHN@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ received @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (40 mg/L) or a calcium channel blocker (@CHEMICAL_lacidipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C060285 @@@lacidipine@@@, 3 mg/kg) from day 7 after surgery to 8 months.

citations.NLM: Benigni A, Gagliardini E, Remuzzi A, Corna D, Remuzzi G. Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibition prevents glomerular-tubule disconnection and atrophy in passive Heymann nephritis, an effect not observed with a calcium antagonist. Am J Pathol. 2001 Nov;159(5):1743-50. PMID: 11696435
